title: More possibly 70's sans-serif typefaces
content:
I can't figure out what these two sans-serif typefaces are. The Art Canada one reminds me a bit of Avant Garde Gothic the way the R looks. I can't even guess at a similar font to WATERWORKS. Any ideas? You guys always seem to be helpful.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [waterworks.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20121029085223/http:/typophile.com/files/waterworks.jpg) | 28.61 KB |
| [artcanada.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20121029085223/http:/typophile.com/files/artcanada.jpg) | 29.78 KB |
author: tylor.reimer

comments.content:
Waterworks reminds me of Neutraface Light with Alternative letters.  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20121029085223/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface")
For A and E you could use Neutraface 2

Yeah I can see some similarities. Maybe someone has something closer. I think Neutraface was based on some older building signage (kind made out of metal) and that's where I got this from and then cleaned it up. Perhaps it is from Richard Neutra's work though I don't know if it was widely available back then or just on the houses he designed.  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

[Tylor j Reimer DOT com](http://web.archive.org/web/20121029085223/http:/www.tylorjreimer.com/)
